history.content:
from EE 16A piazza:

"We will be offering an alternate final for only GRADUATING SENIORS with a CLASS TIME CONFLICT. This alternate time is FRI 3-6PM. NO EXCEPTIONS. 

 

If you are a graduating senior in 169 or 170, we have your names. If you have another class conflict, please email me (chor346@berkeley.edu) ASAP.

 

Note that we would have loved to be able to support a much broader population of students with an alternate final, but have checked in to every possible route to do this and it unfortunately turns out to simply not be possible due to space and resource constraints."

children.subject:
Well, the answer months ago (@581) was that there couldn't be an answer until when the semester starts, so I'm not sure why this is unfair. As soon as you know you have a final conflict that might not be resolved, you should have had a back-up; it's not the department's or staff's responsibility to accommodate students signing up for schedule conflicts.

Similarly, courses expanding is never a guarantee that should be fully relied upon; if it was possible to guarantee, then the course would have already been expanded (not that I'm familiar with the 188 situation).
Why exactly are final conflicts hard to accommodate? Don't you just have an official proctor look over a final you are taking given by the teachers who created a different version?
Writing three hours worth of fair exam questions that haven't been used before isn't exactly a trivial task...

If you're going to 3 hours worth of fair questions already anyway, why not let more people take it instead of being selective? Is it really going to cost THAT much more to get an extra room? Is that cost really not worth it so more students will be able to stay on course schedule and being able to take the classes they want to take?

@Steven Bi, its not even fool proof to have a backup. There is no guarantee that you will get into any class that you are wait-listed for. That means some people are able to get into 3 CS upper divs while other people can't get into any they sign up for.

@anon above, SO TRUE

I personally signed up for FOUR techs, two as backups and because of "budget costs" and not allowing more students to take an alternate final even though the test is going to be made ANYWAY (also, how expensive is it to allow 100 or so students to take the alt final?????), I could only get into 1 of the 4 techs. But really, why does this happen every semester?

As far as I know, it's not about price; it's not like we pay per room we use. The issue is more about: is there an actual room that can be requested (e.g. if there are 30 students who have a conflict, in order to have alternate seating, that means you need a room with 50-ish seats, and large rooms are generally already being used by other classes with exams.)

If you are waitlisted for your back-up, that's not foolproof, sure, which is why you probably shouldn't use a class you're waitlisted for as a back-up; it's standard practice to have back-ups for classes you're waitlisted for anyway (which suggests that you have back-ups for your back-ups?).

+282728282

I honestly really do appreciate all the professors and TAs hard work, but this is EXTREMELY unfair, especially considering that there have been many posts since months ago asking whether alternative finals would be given, and it took until literally days prior to school starting to give a definite answer. It's basically impossible to get into most CS classes now, and telling students to "have a back-up" is kind of ridiculous at this point--are we supposed to be watching out for EVERY POSSIBLE OBSTACLE that can happen?? For example, it was said that 188 would expand  to 700 students, and literally just last week did a professor come out and say that it probably won't be happening. I really do feel for these said budget costs, but us students and our parents have dedicated so much money and time to be here as well, and it would be really, really nice if we could get our money and time's worth.

I'm really not trying to make this a long thing of grievances, but I'm truly begging the CS department to please please please please help us out!! Is there ANY way that an alternative final for more people can be offered, or allow 188 to be expanded with we were previously told it would be?

history.content:
Dear Anonymous- I'm very sorry that this has caused you so much frustration. Could you please email me directly? svannostrand@eecs.berkeley.edu

In the mean time, deleting posts containing profanity...

Thanks,

Sarah

Dear Anonymous- I'm very sorry that this has caused you so much frustration. Could you please email me directly? svannostrand@eecs.berkeley.edu

Thanks,

Sarah

I'm so sorry for the billionth 16a/170 conflict question posted on here, but I searched through the past posts and there doesn't seen to be a definite answer from a professor about this. I understand that 170 will not have alternate finals, but will 16a have one?
history.subject: Will EE16a have an alternate final?
